TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently serving a prison term in LOC . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case as submitted by the parties may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant on charges of theft . He was detained in FAC ( GPE lišene slobode ; hereinafter “ the ZPH ” ) in the period DATE and DATE when he was transferred to FAC ( GPE u GPE ) . On DATE , following several convictions for theft , the applicant was transferred to ORG ( Kaznionica u Lepoglavi ; hereinafter : the “ LSP ” ) where he is serving his prison term and is expected to remain until DATE .
CARDINAL . In the period DATE and DATE the applicant was placed in the ZPH , in a room measuring QUANTITY , with CARDINAL other inmates .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , there were no sanitary facilities in the room and it was locked during TIME . For that reason , to urinate at TIME the inmates had to use a plastic bottle . When they needed to defecate at TIME they had to ring for a guard to be able to go to the toilet . However , the guards would not always answer these calls and then the inmates had to use a plastic bag , in full view of the other inmates in the same room . These bags of faeces were then thrown out of the window .

According to the Government , the sanitary conditions in the ZPH were good . The room where the applicant was accommodated did not have sanitary facilities but whenever an inmate had a need for personal hygiene he was able to call the security guards , who then escorted him to the sanitary facilities . Other general conditions of the accommodation were also good . The room had windows which provided fresh air and natural light ; the inmates were served regular meals and they had the opportunity to walk around in the hospital hallways and in the fresh air for TIME during DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to the LSP , where he has been an inmate ever since . He was first placed in a cell measuring QUANTITY , with CARDINAL other inmates , where he remained until DATE , when he was transferred to another cell , measuring QUANTITY , with CARDINAL other inmates .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the sentence - execution judge of ORG PERSON ) about the conditions of his detention in the LSP . He alleged that his cell was inadequate and contrary to the guarantees offered by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the sentence - execution judge of ORG found that the conditions of the applicant ’s detention in the LSP were inadequate as regards the individual space offered to the applicant in a cell measuring QUANTITY and accommodating CARDINAL inmates , and ordered the LSP to take the necessary measures to remedy the situation .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the LSP lodged an appeal against that decision with a CARDINAL - judge panel of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE a CARDINAL - judge panel of ORG dismissed the LSP ’s appeal and upheld the decision of the sentence - execution judge .

CARDINAL . On DATE the LSP authorities offered the applicant a move to another cell . The applicant informed a security guard that he did not want to move from his current cell . He also provided a handwritten statement in which he reiterated that he did not want to leave his cell , because it had never been locked and he was satisfied with the accommodation there . He asked to be placed in a semi - open prison regime , which was refused .
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant provisions of FAC ( Zakon o izvršavanju kazne zatvora , ORG nos . ORG ) , read as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) An inmate may lodge a request for judicial protection against any acts or decisions unlawfully refusing him , or limiting , any of the rights guaranteed by LAW .
( CARDINAL ) NORP for judicial protection shall be decided by a sentence - execution judge . ”
( CARDINAL ) A sentence - execution judge protects the rights of prisoners , supervises lawfulness in respect of the execution of a prison term and ensures equality of prisoners before the law .
( CARDINAL ) A sentence - execution judge takes actions and decisions in respect of :
CARDINAL . judicial protection of those rights by deciding on appeals lodged against a decision by a prison governor in cases prescribed by this Act ...
“ ( CARDINAL ) Proceedings before a sentence - execution judge are initiated in the first instance at the request of a party or a judge and in the second instance upon an appeal .

( CARDINAL ) A sentence - execution judge acts so as to , according to the basic principles , ensure effective protection of the rights and interests of the prisoner concerned . ... The judge shall allow the parties to submit observations about the facts [ presented by ] and allegations put forward by the opponent , and to present new facts and call for evidence .
( CARDINAL ) Parties to proceedings are a prisoner and a prison or other penal institutions .

( CARDINAL ) A prisoner has the right to a lawyer of his or her own choice . Such a lawyer shall have qualifications required for a defence lawyer in criminal proceedings . When a prisoner does not ensure legal representation within TIME , the proceedings shall continue without legal representation .
( CARDINAL ) A prisoner may ask for a legal - aid lawyer when he does not have sufficient means to pay for legal representation and is not able to represent his own interests .

“ A prisoner may lodge an appeal to a sentence - execution judge against decisions of a prison governor within DATE ... ”
